metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46881 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An optimization in WebGL was incorrect in some cases, and could have led tomemory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. *Note*: Thisadvisory was added on December 13th, 2022 after we better understood theimpact of the issue. The fix was included in the original release ofFirefox 106. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 106, Firefox ESR < 102.6,and Thunderbird < 102.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46881` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
